BR_text.BRdescription:
I would've submitted a pull request but perhaps I'm missing something here.
 from spacy.lang.sv import Swedish
 
 nlp = Swedish()
 
 [x.lemma_ for x in nlp('För två år sedan')]
 outputs
 <denchmark-code>['För', 'två', 'åra', 'sedan']
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Here, the word  (year) is lemmatized to  (oar), which is obviously not correct. The mapping from  to  can be found in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/lang/sv/lemmatizer/lookup.py>spacy/lang/sv/lemmatizer/lookup.py</denchmark-link>
 .
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 spaCy version: 2.0.11
 Platform: Darwin-16.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit
 Python version: 3.6.4
 Models: xx_ent_wiki_sm

comments_0.comment_text:
Thanks for the report! (Unfortunately, this often happens with freely available tables and resources that get passed around a lot. They're never 100% perfect – but I'm glad we have a community that spots and reports mistakes like this 🙏)
 What would be the correct solution then? Should år be removed entirely, or should the mapping be replaced with something else? (If you have a second, you could also just submit a PR instead.)

comments_1.comment_text:
should be removed entirely. I submitted <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/2241>a PR here</denchmark-link>
 .

comments_2.comment_text: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
